detaileddescription.para: Last connect time of voice session
libopus decoder
Encoding buffer for opus repacketizer and encode
libopus encoder
File descriptor for UDP connection
Input buffer. Each string is a received UDP packet. These will usually be RTP.

briefdescription.para: IP of UDP/RTP endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: Queue of outbound messages

briefdescription.para: List of supported audio encoding modes.
Output buffer.

detaileddescription.para: If true, audio packet sending is paused

briefdescription.para: Port number of UDP/RTP endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: Mutex for message queue
libopus repacketizer (merges frames into one packet)
Thread this connection is executing on
Secret key for encrypting voice. If it has been sent, this is non-null and points to a sequence of exactly 32 bytes.
This is set to true if we have started sending audio. When this moves from false to true, this causes the client to send the 'talking' notification to the websocket.
Sequence number of outbound audio. This is incremented once per frame sent.
Socket address of voice server

briefdescription.para: SSRC value.

detaileddescription.para: Maps receiving ssrc to user id
Mutex for outbound packet stream

briefdescription.para: Timescale in nanoseconds.

detaileddescription.para: Timestamp value used in outbound audio. Each packet has the timestamp value which is incremented to match how many frames are sent.
Meta data associated with each track. Arbitrary string that the user can set via dpp::discord_voice_client::AddMarker
Number of track markers in the buffer. For example if there are two track markers in the buffer there are 3 tracks. Special case: If the buffer is empty, there are zero tracks in the buffer.
Channel ID
Owning cluster

briefdescription.para: Attaching an additional file descriptor to this function will send notifications when there is data to read.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Only hook this if you NEED it as it can increase CPU usage of the thread! Returning -1 means that you don't want to be notified.

briefdescription.para: This event will be called when you can read from the custom fd.
Attaching an additional file descriptor to this function will send notifications when you are able to write to the socket.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Only hook this if you NEED it as it can increase CPU usage of the thread! You should toggle this to -1 when you do not have anything to write otherwise it'll keep triggering repeatedly (it is level triggered).

briefdescription.para: This event will be called when you can write to a custom fd.

detaileddescription.para: Decode received voice packets to PCM
Heartbeat interval for sending heartbeat keepalive
Last heartbeat
Server ID
Discord voice session id
True when the thread is shutting down
Thread ID
Discord voice session token

briefdescription.para: Clear the outbound message queue.
Encode a byte buffer using opus codec. Multiple opus frames (2880 bytes each) will be encoded into one packet for sending.

parameterdescription.para: Input data as raw bytes of PCM data
Input data length
Output data as an opus encoded packet
Output data length, should be at least equal to the input size. Will be adjusted on return to the actual compressed data size.

simplesect.para: size_t The compressed data size that was encoded.

briefdescription.para: Get the size of the outbound message queue.
Queue a message to be sent via the websocket.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON data of the message to be sent
If set to true, will place the message at the front of the queue not the back (this is for urgent messages such as heartbeat, presence, so they can take precedence over chunk requests etc)

briefdescription.para: Called by ssl_client when there is data to be read. At this point we insert that data into the input queue.
Send data to the UDP socket, using the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: packet data
length of packet
duration of opus packet

detaileddescription.para: Run shard loop under a thread

briefdescription.para: Receive data from UDP socket immediately.

parameterdescription.para: data to receive
size of data receiving buffer

simplesect.para: int bytes received. -1 if there is an error (e.g. EAGAIN)

briefdescription.para: Send data to UDP socket immediately.

parameterdescription.para: data to send
length of data to send

simplesect.para: int bytes sent. Will return -1 if we cannot send

briefdescription.para: This hooks the ssl_client, returning the file descriptor if we want to receive buffered data, or -1 if we are not wanting to receive.
This hooks the ssl_client, returning the file descriptor if we want to send buffered data, or -1 if there is nothing to send.
Called by ssl_client when the socket is ready for writing, at this point we pick the head item off the buffer and send it. So long as it doesnt error completely, we pop it off the head of the queue.

memberdef.argsstring: (dpp::cluster *_cluster, snowflake _channel_id, snowflake _server_id, const std::string &_token, const std::string &_session_id, const std::string &_host)
memberdef.name: discord_voice_client

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor takes shard id, max shards and token.
_cluster
The cluster which owns this voice connection, for related logging, REST requests etc
_channel_id
The channel id to identify the voice connection as
_server_id
The server id (guild id) to identify the voice connection as
_token
The voice session token to use for identifying to the websocket
_session_id
The voice session id to identify with
_host
The voice server hostname to connect to (hostname:port format)
Destructor

briefdescription.para: Close websocket.
Discord external IP detection.

simplesect.para: This is a blocking operation that waits for a single packet from Discord's voice servers.

detaileddescription.para:
Handle a websocket error.
errorcode
The error returned from the websocket
Get total bytes received
Get total bytes sent
Get SSL cipher name

briefdescription.para: Get the metdata string associated with each inserted marker.

simplesect.para: const std::vector<std::string>& list of metadata strings

briefdescription.para: Get the time remaining to send the audio output buffer in hours:minutes:seconds.
Get the number of seconds remaining of the audio output buffer.
Get the current timescale, this will default to 1000000 which means 1 millisecond.
Get the number of tracks remaining in the output buffer. This is calculated by the number of track markers plus one.

simplesect.para: uint32_t Number of tracks in the buffer

briefdescription.para: Returns the connection time of the voice client.

simplesect.para: dpp::utility::uptime Detail of how long the voice client has been connected for

briefdescription.para: Processes incoming frames from the SSL socket input buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer contents. Can modify this value removing the head elements when processed.

detaileddescription.para:
Handle JSON from the websocket.
buffer
The entire buffer content from the websocket client
True if a frame has been handled

briefdescription.para: Insert a track marker into the audio output buffer. A track marker is an arbitrary flag in the buffer contents that indictes the end of some block of audio of significance to the sender. This may be a song from a streaming site, or some voice audio/speech, a sound effect, or whatever you choose. You can later skip to the next marker using the dpp::discord_voice_client::skip_to_next_marker function.

parameterdescription.para: Arbitrary information related to this track

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the voice client is connected to the websocket.
Returns true if the audio is paused. You can unpause with dpp::discord_voice_client::pause_audio.
Returns true if we are playing audio.
voice client is ready to stream audio. The voice client is considered ready if it has a secret key.

simplesect.para: true if ready to stream audio

detaileddescription.para:
Log a message to whatever log the user is using. The logged message is passed up the chain to the on_log event in user code which can then do whatever it wants to do with it.
severity
The log level from dpp::loglevel
msg
The log message to output
Fires every second from the underlying socket I/O loop, used for sending heartbeats

briefdescription.para: Pause sending of audio.

parameterdescription.para: True to pause, false to resume

briefdescription.para: Nonblocking I/O loop.

detaileddescription.para: Start and monitor I/O loop

briefdescription.para: Send opus packets to the voice channel.

detaileddescription.para: Some containers such as .ogg may contain OPUS encoded data already. In this case, we don't need to encode the frames using opus here. We can bypass the codec, only applying libsodium to the stream.
Duration is calculated internally

parameterdescription.para: Opus packets. Discord expects opus frames to be encoded at 48000Hz
The length of the audio data.

simplesect.para: It is your responsibility to ensure that packets of data sent to send_audio are correctly repacketized for streaming, e.g. that audio frames are not too large or contain an incorrect format. Discord will still expect the same frequency and bit width of audio and the same signedness.

briefdescription.para: Send opus packets to the voice channel.

detaileddescription.para: Some containers such as .ogg may contain OPUS encoded data already. In this case, we don't need to encode the frames using opus here. We can bypass the codec, only applying libsodium to the stream.

parameterdescription.para: Opus packets. Discord expects opus frames to be encoded at 48000Hz
The length of the audio data.
Generally duration is 2.5, 5, 10, 20, 40 or 60 if the timescale is 1000000 (1ms)

simplesect.para: It is your responsibility to ensure that packets of data sent to send_audio are correctly repacketized for streaming, e.g. that audio frames are not too large or contain an incorrect format. Discord will still expect the same frequency and bit width of audio and the same signedness.

briefdescription.para: Send raw audio to the voice channel.

detaileddescription.para: You should send an audio packet of n11520 bytes. Note that this function can be costly as it has to opus encode the PCM audio on the fly, and also encrypt it with libsodium.

Because this function encrypts and encodes packets before pushing them onto the output queue, if you have a complete stream ready to send and know its length it is advisable to call this method multiple times to enqueue the entire stream audio so that it is all encoded at once (unless you have set use_opus to false). Constantly calling this from the dpp::on_voice_buffer_send callback can and will eat a TON of cpu!
audio_data
Raw PCM audio data. Channels are interleaved, with each channel's amplitude being a 16 bit value.
The audio data should be 48000Hz signed 16 bit audio.

parameterdescription.para: The length of the audio data. The length should be a multiple of 4 (2x 16 bit stero channels) with a maximum length of 11520, which is a complete opus frame at highest quality.

briefdescription.para: Send silence to the voice channel.

parameterdescription.para: How long to send silence for. With the standard timescale this is in milliseconds. Allowed values are 2.5, 5, 10, 20, 40 or 60 milliseconds.

briefdescription.para: Set the timescale in nanoseconds.

parameterdescription.para: Timescale to set. This defaults to 1000000, which means 1 millisecond.

briefdescription.para: Skip tp the next track marker, previously inserted by using the dpp::discord_voice_client::insert_marker function. If there are no markers in the output buffer, then this skips to the end of the buffer and is equivalent to the dpp::discord_voice_client::stop_audio function.

simplesect.para: It is possible to use this function while the output stream is paused.

briefdescription.para: Mark the voice connection as 'speaking'. This sends a JSON message to the voice websocket which tells discord that the user is speaking. The library automatically calls this for you whenever you send audio.
Immediately stop all audio. Clears the packet queue.
Write to websocket. Encapsulates data in frames if the status is CONNECTED.

parameterdescription.para: The data to send.

detaileddescription.para: (Re)connect

Get websocket state
websocket state
Input buffer received from openssl
Bytes in
Bytes out
SSL cipher in use
Hostname connected to
For timers
True if in nonblocking mode. The socket switches to nonblocking mode once ReadLoop is called.
Output buffer for sending to openssl
Raw file descriptor of connection
Openssl opaque contexts

briefdescription.para: Implements a discord voice connection. Each discord_voice_client connects to one voice channel and derives from a websocket client.
